text: Newton was born in 1642 into an England
they were the country in transition and
that was a start of the English Civil
War it was a country where they were
still hunting for witches but also he
was a country where science where
rational thought where reason were
beginning to flower that at the time one
of the great questions was about the
nature of light it was known that if you
take a prism and shine some light
through it then he splits some light
into all the colors of the rainbow the
question was why now the prevailing
scientific view was that sunlight must
be perfect this dated all the way back
to Aristotle and the ancient Greeks how
could something that comes from the
heavens be anything other than perfect
[Music]
the common explanation for the
appearance of the colors was that they
were impurities added by the prism to
the pure white light Newton thought that
the colors were already present in the
white sunlight but what's that Newton
apart was the fact that he devised and
performed an experiment to test his
hypothesis first he made a rainbow by
shining white light through a prism then
and here's the genius introduced the
slit into that rainbow beam and that
allowed him to isolate a particular
color of light and shine that into a
second prism then he looked for the
deflection of the colored light onto his
wall you can see that over there now
look what happens when I move the red
light across the slit to the green light
on the wall what you see is green light
into the prism equals green light out
now that implies that the colors
themselves are pure the prism is not
adding off the
tracting anything that means that
newton's hypothesis was shown to be
correct the colors themselves are the
basic building blocks of light and white
light is made up of all those individual
colors that's genius
[Music]
